ScientiIc calculators have a key for natural logarithms, so Formula 10 enables us
to use a calculator to compute a logarithm with any base (as shown in the following
example). Similarly, Formula 10 allows us to graph any logarithmic function on a graph-
ing calculator or computer (see Exercises 43 and 44).
Graph and Growth of the Natural Logarithm

and its inverse function, the natural loga-
rithm function, are shown in Figure 13. Because the curve
